title: Para-athletes lament training and support gaps post-Asiad miss
description: Preeti Pal, a para-athlete from Meerut, narrowly missed out on a medal at the Asian Para Games in China. She lost out by fractions of a second in the 100m and 200m races due to lack of proper training facilities. Similarly, other para-athletes like Suvarna Raj and Tripti Rajput faced challenges in accessing training facilities due to cost and distance. Coaches and athletes are calling for more support and infrastructure for para-athletes in India.

title: Calm chokes on its own emissions; Punjab fires top 1 k
description: Delhi's air quality worsened to the 'very poor' range on Sunday, with pollution levels increasing throughout the day. Stubble burning incidents in Punjab crossed 1,000 for the first time this season, contributing to the pollution load. Local sources of pollution within Delhi were identified as the main factor behind the city's poor air quality, with calm winds preventing the dispersal of emissions. Experts predict that Delhi's air quality is likely to remain in the 'very poor' category for the next few days, as strong winds are needed to disperse pollutants.

title: Off-duty officer shot at while playing cricket in Srinagar, critical
description: An off-duty police inspector in Jammu and Kashmir, Masroor Ahmad Wani, was critically injured when a terrorist attacked him while he was playing cricket with friends. This marks the first attack on an off-duty cop in the region this year. The attacker, identified as Basit Dar from Kulgam, is associated with the Pakistan-backed Lashkar-e-Taiba's covert branch, The Resistance Force. The police have launched a search operation to apprehend the attacker, and authorities believe they will catch him soon. The attack was claimed by The Resistance Force, accusing Wani of mistreating civilians.

title: At least 10 dead, 25 injured as 2 passenger trains collide in AP
description: A passenger train derailed in Andhra Pradesh, India, after colliding with another train, resulting in at least 10 deaths and 25 injuries. This is the third rail accident in the country since June. The accident occurred when one train was switching tracks and was rear-ended by the other train. Rescue operations were hindered by the darkness, but locals assisted in the effort.  The Prime Minister and Chief Minister expressed condolences and provided compensation to the victims.

title: At least 10 dead, 25 injured as 2 passenger trains collide in AP
description: A passenger train derailed in Andhra Pradesh, India, after colliding with another train, resulting in at least 10 deaths and 25 injuries. This is the third rail accident in the country since June. The accident occurred when one train was switching tracks and was rear-ended by the other train. Rescue operations were hindered by the darkness, but locals assisted in the effort.  The Prime Minister and Chief Minister expressed condolences and provided compensation to the victims.

title: Kerala Convention Centre blasts: 'Had just closed eyes to pray, then there were blasts & fire'
description: A 14-year-old boy named Ashwin and several others were injured in back-to-back explosions at a prayer session in Kochi. Ashwin, who had traveled with his mother to the venue, suffered hand and face injuries. A nurse named Aksa also suffered burns on her hands. Attendees stated that the organizers had given a safety demonstration, which helped reduce casualties. One attendee named Abhishek risked his life to save elderly people and had to be shifted to the ICU due to smoke inhalation.

title: Citizens don't have right to know electoral bond sources: Centre to SC
description: The Attorney General of India, R Venkataramani, has submitted his views to the Supreme Court regarding petitions challenging the electoral bond mode of funding political parties. He stated that citizens do not have a fundamental right to know the source of these funds and cautioned the court against entering the policy domain for regulating electoral bonds. The Attorney General argued that the scheme does not violate any existing rights and ensures clean money is contributed. He also emphasized the importance of parliamentary debates on such matters.

title: Mob storms Russian airport to protest flight from Israel
description: Hundreds of people entered the main airport in Russia's Dagestan region on Sunday and went onto the landing field to protest the arrival of an airplane from Tel Aviv, Israel.This incident was reported by Russian news agencies and on social media. As a result of the protest, the airport in Makhachkala, which is the capital of this mainly Muslim region, had to be closed, and the police were called to the scene. As of now, there are no immediate reports of injuries or arrests.

title: Indian pacers look best in the world: Wasim Akram
description: Mohammed Shami led an inspired bowling display as India hammered England by 100 runs on Sunday to stay unbeaten in the World Cup and all but push the defending champions out of the semi-final race.

title: 'I think England can still qualify...': Jaffer trolls Vaughan
description: India showcased their dominance by clinching a remarkable 100-run victory over England for their sixth consecutive win in the tournament in a thrilling match in the World Cup in Lucknow.  The triumph was made possible by the exceptional opening spells from Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Shami, following skipper Rohit Sharma's resilient innings of 87 on a challenging pitch. Former India opener Jaffer trolled Michael Vaughan soon after India handed England a crushing 100-run defeat in the World Cup game in Lucknow.

title: Assembly polls: Congress announces six guarantees in Telangana
'You don't see that every day when...': Rohit lauds bowlers
description: India's relentless march in the ODI World Cup persisted as they handed England a crushing 100-run defeat, securing their sixth consecutive victory and all but guaranteeing their place in the semifinals. Despite defending a total below par, the Indian bowlers stepped up, with Mohammed Shami (4/22) and Jasprit Bumrah (3/32) wreaking havoc to maintain India's unbeaten streak in the World Cup. Showering accolades on the remarkable performance of the bowlers, Rohit expressed that such a display is not an everyday occurrence, highlighting how the pacers effectively exploited the favorable conditions.

title: "Team India know how to....": Afridi after India's sixth win in a row
description: Mohammed Shami claimed 4 wickets, while Jasprit Bumrah bagged three as India hammered England by 100 runs on Sunday in a low-scoring affair to stay unbeaten in the World Cup and all but push the defending champions out of the semi-final race. With this win, Rohit Sharma and Co have jumped to the top of the points table. They have an NRR of +1.405. Chasing a tricky 230 for victory at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow, England collapsed to 129 all out in 34.5 overs to suffer their fifth defeat in six matches.

title: Two dead, 52 injured in blasts at religious gathering in Kerala
description: Shortly after the incident, an individual claiming to be a Jehovah's Witnesses member surrendered to the police in Thrissur district, confessing to carrying out the explosions. Law enforcement registered a First Information Report (FIR) against unknown suspects under Sections 302 (murder) and 307 (attempted murder) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC), along with charges related to the Explosives Act and the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA), an anti-terror law.

title: How India demolished England to maintain perfect record
description: India maintained their unbeaten streak at the 2023 World Cup with a 100-run victory in a low-scoring contest against holders England, who are facing a premature exit following their fifth defeat in six group matches on Sunday. Rohit Sharma saved India's blushes with a captain's knock of 87 in what initially appeared a below-par total of 229-9 on a tricky surface at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow. England were reduced to 52-5 inside 16 overs in a remarkable batting capitulation and were eventually bundled out for 129 in inside 35 overs with Mohammed Shami claiming 4-22 for India.

title: Bangladesh arrests top oppn leader amid anti-govt protests
description: Clashes between supporters of Bangladesh's main opposition party, the BNP, and the ruling Awami League have resulted in three deaths. The clashes occurred during a nationwide general strike called by the BNP to protest police action at a rally. Several buses were damaged or set on fire, and there have been numerous arrests of BNP leaders and activists. The BNP has now called for a countrywide blockade in response to the violence. International observers, including the EU and the US, have condemned the violence and called for restraint.

title: Man celebrating success in Bihar civil services exam gets news about dad's death
description: Lalan Kumar Bharti, youngest son of Jagdish Das from Barhat block in Jamui district, had gone into celebration mode when he was declared successful in the 67th Combined Competitive Examination conducted by the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC). He was allotted the coveted Bihar Administrative Service.

title: Why hybrid hiring is becoming the new norm at top institutes
description: Leading Indian institutes like IIT and IIM have embraced hybrid hiring as a permanent practice post-Covid. They offer both online and offline recruitment options to hiring companies. This move benefits recruiters saving time and costs, and provides equal opportunities to institutes in remote areas.

title: Watch: Kohli, Raina share a warm hug during India-England match
description: A heartwarming moment unfolded for the crowd during the World Cup match between India and England in Lucknow on Sunday as Virat Kohli met and shared a warm embrace with former India batter Suresh Raina.

title: The rise, fall and arrest of Do Kwon: A Crypto odyssey
description: Do Kwon, the founder of TerraUSD and Luna, is facing legal trouble after the collapse of his cryptocurrency tokens, resulting in a $40 billion market loss. Kwon and his associate were detained in Montenegro while attempting to flee to Dubai. South Korea and the US are seeking his extradition, but Montenegrin officials may wait for local legal proceedings to conclude. Kwon's detention has sparked political turmoil in Montenegro, with allegations of connections to a politician who invested in Luna. Kwon is accused of deceiving investors and secretly accumulating crypto wealth. The collapse of TerraUSD had global repercussions, affecting investors worldwide.

title: Visakhapatnam-Rayagada passenger train derails in Andhra
Gunman opens fire at Halloween party in Chicago, 15 hurt
Watch: Bumrah claims two wickets in two balls vs England
description: 'Cometh the hour, cometh the man' phrase perfectly suits India's pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah as he picked up two wickets in two balls to give England denting blows early in the innings while defending a below-par total of 229 in the ICC World Cup match in Lucknow on Sunday.  The incident occurred during the fifth over of the England innings when Bumrah first cleaned up opener Dawid Malan on the penultimate delivery and then finished his over with a prized scalp of Joe Root for a golden duck.

title: Haryana school principal accused of molestation suspended following PMO's intervention
description: Officials have confirmed that the Prime Minister's Office, the Women's Commission, the Education Department, and local authorities are actively investigating the matter, with further action to be determined once the final reports are available.

title: Eyewitness accounts detail horror of Kerala blast
UP: Doctor suspended for negligence and alcohol influence
description: The incident came to light after the death of a 26-year-old patient, Shrilal, who was admitted to the Jalaun CHC with deteriorated health but Dr Kumar advised him to get a blood test done from a private pathology lab instead of the hospital lab. While going to a private lab to give a sample on the third day, he died in a way. Attendants complained with Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak who ordered a probe.

title: UP: Doctor suspended for negligence and alcohol influence
description: The incident came to light after the death of a 26-year-old patient, Shrilal, who was admitted to the Jalaun CHC with deteriorated health but Dr Kumar advised him to get a blood test done from a private pathology lab instead of the hospital lab. While going to a private lab to give a sample on the third day, he died in a way. Attendants complained with Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak who ordered a probe.

title: Man found hanging in Gujarat's Junagadh; 'suicide note' names Cong MLA
description: A purported suicide note was recovered in the possession of the deceased, Nitin Parmar, which indicated that he was taking this extreme step due to issues involving his in-laws and a Congress MLA.

title: 'Will use all means to fight': Israel on Musk's offer to Gaza
description: Israel has responded to Elon Musk's offer to provide communication links in Gaza by stating it will use all means to fight this. They expressed concerns that the links could be used by Hamas for terrorist activities. Musk had announced that his company SpaceX's satellite internet system, Starlink, would provide connectivity to aid organizations in Gaza after Israel disabled communication services. US representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez criticized Israel's communication cut off, and Musk affirmed that Starlink will support connectivity to aid organizations in Gaza.

title: Barmy Army slammed by Indian fans for trolling Kohli
description: Virat Kohli suffered a rare failure in the ongoing ODI World Cup after being dismissed for a duck against England. This was the former Indian skipper's first-ever duck in the history of the ODI World Cups. Kohli's underwhelming performance presented an opportunity for England's Barmy Army to troll him. They took to their X handle to share a meme expressing their joy over Kohli's dismissal. But England supporters' group act did not go well with Indian fans as they wasted no time to give them a reality check and apprised them of England's position in the World Cup points table.

title: BSF jawan 'kills' self in Chhattisgarh's Kanker district
description: The incident took place on Saturday at a BSF camp in Sarangipal village under the Rowghat police station limits, around 200 km from the capital Raipur, the police said.

title: Police inspector shot by terrorists in Srinagar, critically wounded
Kerala blasts: Man surrenders before police; takes responsibility
description: Earlier, State Police Chief Shaik Darvesh Saheb informed the media in Thiruvananthapuram that, according to preliminary investigations, the explosions were caused by improvised explosive devices (IEDs), and further examinations are underway.

title: 'Not obsessed with tons': Gambhir lauds 'selfless leader' Rohit
description: Rohit Sharma has been in superb touch in the ongoing ODI World Cup in India, scoring close to 400 runs in six matches so far. With a ton and a couple of fifties already to his name, the skipper has given the team perfect starts. Former India opener Gautam Gambhir on Sunday heaped praise on Rohit, saying that the skipper has led his team from the front.

title: Rifts open: Israel's Netanyahu apologises after taking swipe at intel chiefs over Hamas attack
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu issued an apology to his intelligence and security chiefs after accusing them of not informing him about a planned attack by Hamas. Israel was caught off guard by the attack, which resulted in the deaths of at least 1,400 Israelis. Netanyahu's remarks sparked political uproar, with opposition leaders and even members of his own cabinet calling for him to retract his statement. The prime minister has yet to take responsibility for the intelligence failure, stating that tough questions will be asked after the war.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper train enters production stage
description: Vande Bharat sleeper train prototype by Indian Railways has finally entered production stage and is expected to be rolled out by BEML and ICF by March 2024.

title: Watch: Virat punches the sofa after getting out for a duck
description: The England fast bowlers put up a spirited display after their skipper Jos Buttler won the toss and opted to bowl first against India in Lucknow on Sunday. The burst by English pacers included the wicket of Virat Kohli, who fell for a nine-ball duck. Before Kohli's dismisal, Chris Woakes bowled opener Shubman Gill (9) and then came back to reduce India to 40/3 with the dismissal of Shreyas Iyer (4), but Rohit Sharma went on to complete his half-century.

title: Rohit achieves twin milestones during WC match vs England
description: Rohit Sharma, in his 100th international match as captain, etched a memorable moment by completing 1000 runs in ODIs in the current year. The Indian skipper achieved the milestone during the ODI World Cup 2023 match against England at Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow on Sunday. More importantly, Rohit is the only skipper to have scored 1000 ODI runs in 2023 and third batter overall to attain the feat after compatriot Shubman Gill and Sri Lanka opener Pathum Nissanka.

title: Rahul vows to prioritize farm loan waiver, caste census in Chhattisgarh
description: ​​Addressing an impressive election meeting in Rajnandgaon in poll bound Chhattisgarh, he mentioned that the Congress governments in Karnataka and Rajasthan have already initiated the process of a caste survey. In Chhattisgarh, this process will commence immediately after the Congress regains power in next month's assembly elections.

title: Kohli falls for a duck for first time in ODI World Cups
description: In an unwarranted record, star India batter Virat Kohli on Sunday was dismissed for a duck for the first time ever in ODI World Cups. The uncalled for record for Kohli came against England in India's sixth match of the cricketing extravaganza in Lucknow. Left-arm quick David Willey claimed the prized scalp after Kohli played a loose shot to be caught at mid-off by Ben Stokes and walked off to stunned silence at the Ekana Stadium.

title: Noida: Delivery boy arrested in physical assault case after gunfight
description: The suspect, identified as Sumit Sharma, hailing from Achheja village in Greater Noida, was taken into custody by the police. According to Hirdesh Katheriya, the Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police for Central Noida, the arrest took place on a Sunday morning in the Khairpur village area of Noida Extension. Subsequently, Sumit Sharma was brought to the Bisrakh police station by officers including Sinastha Chaudhary and SI Bharat Singh.

title: Why Matthew Perry once 'beat up' young Justin Trudeau
description: The sudden passing of 'Friends' star Matthew Perry has left fans worldwide saddened, including Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, who was once Perry's schoolmate. Trudeau paid tribute to Perry, reminiscing about the schoolyard games they used to play. This sparked interest among netizens about Perry's earlier years in Canada, including a story Perry shared about beating up a young Trudeau in fifth grade due to jealousy. Trudeau responded with humor, suggesting a rematch and jokingly referencing Perry's character, Chandler, from 'Friends'.

title: WC: Indian players wear black armbands in tribute to Bedi
description: Indian players took the field in their ICC World Cup match against England on Sunday wearing black armbands as a mark of tribute to legendary Indian spinner Bishan Singh Bedi, who passed away on October 23. India, who are so far unbeaten in this edition of the World Cup after five matches, were put in to bat first by England skipper Jos Buttler in Lucknow. Defending champions England have  won just one match and lost four so far in the tournament.

title: Sachin vs Virat: Nasser weighs in on all-time great debate
description: Indian cricketers Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli are considered the greatest batters of all time, with their indelible mark on run-making and global adoration. Tendulkar inspired a generation to embrace cricket, while Kohli's consistency has placed him in the league of legendary players. This has sparked a passionate debate among fans regarding who deserves the title of the greatest One Day International (ODI) batter. Former England cricketer Nasser Hussain has offered his perspective on the debate, declaring Tendulkar as the greatest batter he has ever witnessed or faced on the field.

title: Babar Azam reveals his three favourite batters in the world
description: Babar Azam has expressed admiration for three world-class batters, Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and Kane Williamson, despite the intense rivalry between India and Pakistan. Kohli and Sharma have been among the top run-scorers in the World Cup, with Kohli scoring 354 runs in five innings and Sharma scoring 311 runs in an equal number of innings. Azam also praised New Zealander Kane Williamson for his calm demeanor, despite the fierce rivalry.

title: What we know about Hamas ex-chief’s who addressed Kerala rally
description: Former Hamas chief Khaled Meshaal virtually addressed a rally in support of Palestinians organised by a Jamaat-e-Islami Hind-aligned outfit in Kerala's Malappuram on Friday, sparking a row.  Organisers SYM said Hamas is a "resistance movement" and Meshaal a "freedom fighter". Born in the West Bank in 1956, Khaled is considered one of the founders of Hamas. Under direct instructions from Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel's Mossad spy agency attempted to assassinate Meshaal in 1997 while he was living in Jordan.

title: Most expensive cities to park you car in 2023
description: Apart from the stress of driving a car in a busy city, vehicle owners often need to pay higher premiums to maintain the luxury of having a personal vehicle in these hubs. One of the added cost of owning a car in such a metro, is public parking costs. Here are six major cities around the world that have the highest amount of parking charges when compared to other cities in their respective countries.

title: Nationwide platform to be launched on Sardar Patel's birth anniversary, PM says
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the launch of 'Mera Yuva Bharat', a nationwide platform aimed at involving young people in nation-building initiatives. The platform will be launched on October 31, Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel's birth anniversary. Modi encouraged the youth to register on the upcoming 'Mera Yuva Bharat' website, emphasizing that it will empower them to actively participate in national development. He also urged the public to support local products and highlighted the record sales of Khadi on Gandhi Jayanti.

title: One killed, over 20 injured in blast at convention centre in Kochi
description: During a Jehovah's Witnesses prayer meeting on a Sunday in Kalamassery, Kochi, a blast occurred at a convention center, resulting in at least one fatality and over 20 individuals sustaining injuries. The local police have noted that the cause of the blast remains unconfirmed, and it is uncertain whether multiple explosions were involved. The incident took place at a convention center associated with a Christian group, and authorities were alerted to the situation when they received a distress call around 9 am, prompting a request for police assistance.

title: Did you know Ram Charan's 6-yr-old half cousin who is half Russian?
description: The Konidela family is a prominent film dynasty in Telugu cinema, with three generations involved in cinema, business, and politics. Chiranjeevi became a megastar and also ventured into politics. The family includes other actors such as Sai Dharam Tej, Vaishnav Tej, Varun Tej, and Ram Charan. Chiranjeevi's daughters Sushmita and Sreeja are also involved in the film industry. Pawan Kalyan, Chiranjeevi's brother, is an actor, director, and politician.

title: Multiple blasts in Kerala: What we know so far
US: Three wounded in shooting at Chula Vista mall
MLB: Arizona tie World Series with convincing win against Texas
description: Merrill Kelly's dominant performance helped the Arizona Diamondbacks level the World Series at 1-1 with a 9-1 victory over Texas. Kelly struck out nine batters and allowed only three hits over seven innings. Gabriel Moreno hit a home run, and Ketel Marte set a new MLB playoff hit streak record.

title: Apple India's revenue booms; nears Rs 50k cr record growth
description: Apple's India business almost touched a record milestone of Rs 50,000-crore revenue, with sales growing by 48% to Rs 49,321 crore in the fiscal year 2022-23. Analysts attribute this growth to a higher share of sales of new generation devices and a reduction in component costs.

title: In rare feat, 16-yr-old Jain girl completes 110-day fast
description: A 16-year-old girl in Mumbai, India, has completed a 110-day fast, an unusual achievement for someone her age with no prior experience of long-term fasting. Krisha Shah began her fast on July 11, consuming only boiled water between 9 am and 6.30 pm. She extended her fast from the initial 16 days to 110 days, surprising her family and gurus. Krisha's achievement has been hailed as an example of self-control and discipline. She lost around 18 kilograms during the three months and received blessings from revered Jain leaders during a grand celebration.

title: 'Concussion ka bahana banaya...': Umar Gul accuses Shadab Khan
description: All-rounder Shadab Khan banged his head on the ground while trying to run out opener Quinton de Kock in the first over of South Africa's run-chase of 271. After getting some on-field medical attention, he walked off the park as a precaution for a concussion injury and was later replaced by Usama Mir. But former Pakistan pacer Umar Gul has accused Shadab of faking his injury. "I don't think he had a serious injury," said Gul talking on a news channel.

title: Cow swayamvar in Andhra Pradesh: Bulls from across nation to test their luck
World Cup: How Rohit Sharma has excelled as a leader and enforcer
description: Rohit Sharma will be captaining India for the 100th time in a match against England. He has established himself as a successful leader, with impressive win percentages across formats. In this World Cup, Rohit's bowling and fielding decisions have been praised, and he has also transformed his batting approach to prioritize quick starts over accumulation. His meticulous preparation and self-reliance have contributed to his success, and he has been able to mentor both young and experienced players.

title: World Cup: Pitch comes in focus as India take on England
description: The Indian cricket team, including captain Rohit Sharma and coach Rahul Dravid, spent time inspecting the pitch in Lucknow ahead of their match against England. The pitch has been a subject of concern in the past, with Hardik Pandya calling it a "shocker" earlier this year. India will be hoping for consistent bounce and run-scoring opportunities on the red soil surface. The absence of Pandya means India may have to drop either Mohammed Shami or Mohammed Siraj to accommodate an extra spinner.

title: Elon Musk’s X may launch a news distribution service
description: Elon Musk and Linda Yaccarino discussed the changes and vision for X (formerly known as Twitter) during an all-hands meeting. Musk plans to launch a news distribution service called XWire, which aims to compete with platforms like Cision's PR Newswire. Musk wants to make X a trusted news platform, encouraging citizen journalism and stating that relevant news is already available on X. In contrast, Instagram Threads, a competitor to X, is moving away from amplifying news on its platform. Meta, the owner of Instagram and Facebook, has had difficult relationships with news publishers.

title: How to know if someone has blocked you on WhatsApp
description: WhatsApp, the popular messaging platform owned by Facebook, does not provide a definitive way to know if someone has blocked you. However, there are certain signs that can indicate if you have been blocked. These include not being able to see the person's last seen or online status, not seeing updates to their profile photo, receiving only one check mark when sending messages, and calls not going through. It's important to note that these signs are not foolproof and could also be due to other reasons such as privacy settings or internet connection issues.

title: Mahua Moitra can depose Nov 2: Ethics panel
description: The ethics committee of Lok Sabha has agreed to reschedule TMC MP Mahua Moitra's deposition in the "cash-for-query" scam, but has made it clear that no further postponements will be accepted. Moitra had acknowledged sharing her Parliament login details with businessman Darshan Hiranandani, and the committee has asked her to appear on November 2 instead of October 31. The TMC has dismissed the parliamentary probe as "politically motivated" and Moitra has denied taking cash from Hiranandani. The committee has stated that no further requests for extension will be entertained.

title: 32 killed, 63 hurt in vehicle pileup on Egypt highway
description: At least 32 people were killed and 63 others injured in a multi-car pileup on a highway between Cairo and Alexandria in Egypt. The accident occurred on a foggy Saturday morning when a passenger bus collided with a parked vehicle, causing other cars to slam into the bus and catch fire. The Egyptian Meteorological Authority had issued a warning about heavy fog on highways the day before the accident. Traffic accidents are a common occurrence in Egypt.

title: India abstain as UNGA backs ceasefire
description: The UN General Assembly adopted a resolution calling for a humanitarian truce in the West Asia crisis, with support from 120 countries. India abstained from voting, citing that the final text did not reflect all elements of its position, including the condemnation of terrorism. The resolution was opposed by the US and Israel, while many European countries supported it. India expressed concern over the loss of civilian lives and urged all parties to de-escalate and work towards peace negotiations.

title: 'Friends' actor Matthew Perry found dead at home: Reports
description: Matthew Perry, best known for his role in the TV series 'Friends,' has passed away at the age of 54. Perry was found dead in his Los Angeles apartment, with no drugs found at the scene. The Los Angeles Police Department responded to the incident, but the identity of the deceased has not been officially confirmed. TMZ reported that there was no foul play involved.

title: ED arrests two promoters, CA of pharma co
description: The Enforcement Directorate has arrested Vineet and Pranav Gupta, promoters of Parabolic Drugs, and their chartered accountant, S K Bansal, in connection with a bank fraud and money laundering case amounting to Rs 1,600 crore. The Guptas are also founders of Ashoka University, which is being investigated in relation to the case. The university has denied any link to the pharmaceutical company. The ED has justified the arrest, stating that the accused were evasive during interrogation. Searches are ongoing in various locations to gather evidence of money laundering.

title: Friends actor Matthew Perry found dead at home: Reports
Kharif acreage up over '22, but output estimated lower
description: Despite below-normal monsoon rainfall, Kharif acreage in India has increased by 2 lakh hectares compared to last year. However, the country's foodgrain output for this season is estimated to be 4.5% less than the previous year. The first advance estimates for 2023-24 show a 3.8% decrease in paddy output. These figures are expected to be revised as the ministry plans to use advanced technology to estimate crop output. Final and accurate figures will be available by mid-next year. The traditional method of manual yield measurements has limitations and is prone to errors.

title: 32 killed in Kazakh coal mine blaze; govt to nationalise firm
description: Kazakhstan's President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev said ArcelorMittal "has turned out to be the worst in our history from the point of view of cooperation with the government". He ordered his cabinet to stop investment cooperation with the firm. The government confirmed it was working to finalise a plan to nationalise the company, which also operates the country's biggest steel mill. Last month, First Deputy PM Roman Sklyar said Kazakhstan was in talks with potential investors who could take over the mill. agencies

title: Loan dues can't take away fundamental right: HC
description: The Delhi High Court has ruled that a person's fundamental rights cannot be taken away for non-payment of a loan. The court quashed a look-out circular (LOC) issued against a man who defaulted on loans for two cars. The court stated that the petitioner's appearance in court nullified the earlier order declaring him a proclaimed offender, rendering the LOC invalid. The court directed the petitioner to cooperate with the investigating agency and deposit a security amount, while prohibiting him from disposing of his cars during the proceedings.

title: Govt digitises land records to make property sales safe
description: The Delhi government's revenue department has made all land records easily accessible to the public to prevent fraudulent transactions, corruption, and delays in registration. The digitized records of various types of lands and properties have been integrated with the Delhi Online Registration Information System (DORIS) portal. People can now check if a property is disputed or marked for demolition on the portal before making a deal. The details of disputed and acquired properties have been provided, and the data is still being updated. Sub-registrars have access to the central server to verify the authenticity of records before registration.

title: Season's coldest night; AQI falls to 'very poor'
description: The air quality in Delhi has reached the "very poor" category with an AQI of 304 due to calm wind conditions, low temperatures, and a low mixing layer height. The city recorded its coldest night of the season with a minimum temperature of 14.3°C. Satellite data shows an increase in farm fires in north-west India. Jahangirpuri was the most polluted station in the city with an AQI of 409. Measures under Stage II of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) are already in place. The air quality is expected to remain "very poor" till October 31.

title: Amid boom in illegal farmhouses, trees vanish from Aravali land
description: Illegal construction and tree felling continue in the protected Aravali land of Raisina hills in Gurgaon, despite regulations prohibiting it. The area, designated as 'uncultivable hill', is protected under the Punjab Land Preservation Act and the Aravali Notification of 1992. Locals have reported trucks bringing rocks and chopping trees to make way for new farmhouses. Despite previous rulings by the National Green Tribunal, illegal construction and encroachments persist.

title: Amid boom in illegal farmhouses, trees vanish from Aravali land
description: Illegal construction and tree felling continue in the protected Aravali land of Raisina hills in Gurgaon, despite regulations prohibiting it. The area, designated as 'uncultivable hill', is protected under the Punjab Land Preservation Act and the Aravali Notification of 1992. Locals have reported trucks bringing rocks and chopping trees to make way for new farmhouses. Despite previous rulings by the National Green Tribunal, illegal construction and encroachments persist.

title: Delivery agent gropes customer at G Noida flat
description: A 25-year-old man delivering groceries from an online store allegedly sexually assaulted a 19-year-old woman in Greater Noida. The woman managed to free herself and call for help, but the delivery man fled the scene. The police have registered a case against the accused and are scanning CCTV footage to apprehend him. The incident raises concerns about security protocols in residential complexes for visitors and deliveries at odd hours. The e-commerce company has not commented on the incident.
